summary: Configure and route filesystem backends for deep agents with policy enforcement, including built-in and custom options.

structure.title: Backends
structure.summary: Configure and route filesystem backends for deep agents, including built-in and custom options, with policy enforcement.

nodes.title: Quickstart
nodes.summary: Introduces quick setup of pre-built filesystem backends for deep agents, including ephemeral, local, durable, and composite options.

nodes.title: Built-in backends
nodes.summary: Describes built-in backends for LangGraph, including ephemeral state, local disk, LangGraph Store, and a composite router for mixed storage solutions.

nodes.title: StateBackend (ephemeral)
nodes.summary: Describes the ephemeral StateBackend for storing files in LangGraph agent state, persisting across multiple turns within the same thread.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Built-in backends > FilesystemBackend (local disk)
nodes.title: FilesystemBackend (local disk)
nodes.summary: Describes the FilesystemBackend for local disk usage, including configuration and use cases.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Built-in backends > StoreBackend (LangGraph Store)
nodes.title: StoreBackend (LangGraph Store)
nodes.summary: Describes the configuration and usage of StoreBackend with LangGraph Store for durable cross-thread storage in deep agents.

nodes.title: CompositeBackend (router)
nodes.summary: Describes the CompositeBackend router, which routes file operations to different backends based on path prefixes, enabling mixed storage solutions.

nodes.title: Specify a backend
nodes.summary: Describes how to specify a backend for `create_deep_agent` using an instance or factory, with default being `StateBackend`.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Route to different backends
nodes.title: Route to different backends
nodes.summary: Route parts of the namespace to different backends, such as persisting `/memories/*` with FilesystemBackend and keeping others ephemeral with StateBackend.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Use a virtual filesystem
nodes.title: Use a virtual filesystem
nodes.summary: Design and implement a custom backend to integrate remote or database filesystems into the tools namespace, with examples for S3 and Postgres.

nodes.title: Add policy hooks
nodes.summary: Add policy hooks to enforce enterprise rules by subclassing or wrapping a backend to block writes/edits under selected prefixes.

nodes.title: Protocol reference
nodes.summary: Describes the required endpoints and supporting types for implementing the BackendProtocol.
